To address some of the negative comments I saw in other reviews: Parking is super simple, just look at the photos Lisa sends you. Depending on how you get into the lot it's the first spot that you see. Yes it's oriented differently than some of the other spots, but hopefully you can figure it out anyway. There also seems to be plenty of street parking.
The exterior stairs felt super safe to me. I hauled all my luggage up and down plus my bike and it was fine. If you're not used to metal exterior stairs, you can go around and use the front door. If you don't want to do four flights of stairs at all, you probably need to look elsewhere.
Some of the reviews called the unit "run down", which is not true at all. It's not new construction, probably from the 1920s, but the unit is well kept, nicely appointed, and 10% functional.

Close to downtown Lincoln, very accesible to where you’d like to be if it’s your first time in Nebraska. The space is perfect for two people. Bed is comfortable, open space, great lighting and nice view of the State Capitol. Decent size kitchen with everything you need for cooking. There are games for inviting guest over. Bathroom has beautiful sunlight coming through in the morning. Comfortable bed with enough space. Closet is HUGE, has a lot of room for anything. Living, dinning area are super cozy and comfortable to enjoy.
Super cute space! I recommend it.

Once you get inside the apartment it’s decent it’s actually really cute. I would say cleanliness is mediocre just because there’s nothing you can do to a building like that to make it 100% clean. I almost decided it would be safer to sleep in my car when I pulled up and walked in to a smell that I can’t even describe. It is definitely the most disgusting apartment complex I’ve been in and it comes to an Airbnb. Personally I wouldn’t pay a dollar to stay there it was so disgusting walking to the apartment itself that I felt like I needed to shower four times. Not to mention the next-door neighbors were up all night long smoking some type of drugs. I think meth. Be careful. if u need to stay there , bring mace
Perfect stay for 2 people in a cozy downtown apartment! We loved how close it was to downtown with various dining options. You will have to go up 4 flights of stairs to get to the apartment.

A real comfortable home base for a visit to Lincoln. It has some wonderful old-fashioned touches like a huge closet and an ironing board that folds up into its own wall cabinet (anybody else remember those?), but the kitchen and bathroom are totally updated. There was nothing I needed that wasn't there. Photos are accurate. Within 48 hours, the Lincoln temp ranged from 40s to 90s and the apartment temperature was always comfortable. Do be aware that the washer isn't in the unit.

A clean and comfortable place. Every time I thought to myself that I needed something (a light right here, a throw blanket, a cup of coffee), it was there. Plus there were some great old-fashioned touches like a huge closet and an ironing board that folds out of a wall cabinet. (Anybody else remember those?) I was visiting friends and family in Lincoln, but the apartment would be good as a place to work too--good table and wifi. Note that the washer was not in the unit (I didn't need it, but you might).

Cute historic apartment right across from the state capitol building that is really worth seeing. Do notice that the apartment is on the 4th floor with no elevator (as described by the host). Clean and well furnished.

I am happy to have booked the Capital Condo. Nice to be centrally located in Lincoln, and it was a good value for the space/features.
A word of warning though, you may get too hot up there (it's on the 4th floor) in the summer months, because there is only one A/C unit, which is located in the bedroom. I had trouble getting it to cool the whole place when it was 90 degrees out.
Nice apartment surrounding the capitol. Easy access to downtown and the college campus!

This is a super cute and cozy apartment on the top floor. GREAT view of the sunrise and of the Nebraska State Capitol. Close to downtown and the university. We really enjoyed our time here and would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Lincoln!

Building is close to downtown and within walking distance of several restaurants. The apartment is clean, neat and well decorated. Bed is comfortable. Building reminded us of student housing , which it probably is (food smells in hallways, some noise) but the apartment is adult living. Lots of exercise climbing stairs to the fourth floor unit.

The apartment is in a great location in Lincoln, close to the capitol and about a 2-5 min drive to downtown. the pictures are all accurate ad we loved the character, personal touches, and the bed was very comfy! (it's a firm bed and I loved it) Lisa was very thorough in the check in and out process, making it very easy to get in. It is a walk up a few floors to the apartment, which we didn't mind. We would stay here again anytime!

Great little place! Located within walking distance of O Street bars and restaurants and still very close to the Haymarket and Railyard where it's a very quick drive. The unit is very clean and cozy. It can be a bit noisy since it's an old building and there's a heavy exterior door that will slam. Most people slowly close it though. Bed is very firm which was nice.
Very pretty well appointed apartment. Walking distance to many restaurants.

Our first Airbnb experience and it went smoothly! Lisa provided clear check in/checkout instructions as well as sent pictures to simplify the process/eliminate any questions. Lisa responded very quickly anytime we reached out. Downtown activities are within walking distance from the apartment.

This places is in the center of it all. Right across the street from the capital building and it has great parking. You can walk to UNL and food options. I would stay here again. The decor and set up fits exactly what the description offers. I'll be back.
Adorable! Close to everything. Check in was super easy. Awesome communication. Would definitely stay again
I absolutely loved it.
Great place!
I highly recommend staying. It’s a wonderful, clean condo. The hosts are very helpful.

Lisa is a great host and wants to make sure you enjoy your stay. She was very accommodating and communicated with us through the entire stay. Great location and a quick walk to the Haymarket. Place was very cute and cozy. Great value as well!
Great stay!
Upon arrival I was a little skeptical about the place because the building. The building itself isn’t the nicest, but the unit was spotless. The unit had everything we needed, super cute and clean!
Nice place for a quick stop in Lincoln.
Such a cute place! Right across the street from the capital and super close to a bunch of cute restaurants. My boyfriend and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay!
Fantastic place to stay, right next to the capitol with plenty of great bars and restaurants near by
My first time in an air bnb and it was such a great experience!
Comfortable accommodation at a convenient location.
Great location and comfortable place. Close to downtown, this very retro apt is clean and relaxing. It’s on a fourth floor with no elevator, so plan on lots of stairs. But it’s worth it.
This place is super clean inside and an amazing value!
we had a great time staying at Lisa's! The place was super cute and had everything we needed. Slept great in the comfy bed. Great location. Would absolutely recommend.
Great little place right across the street from the Capital. Close to lots of food/drinks.
Lisa's place was cute and fun and a great location. Her games were great and the place felt so cozy. The sun coming in the space was quite lovely! I would come again for sure! Thanks, Lisa!
Lisa's place is lovely! Agree with other reviews - don't let the building itself tell the story. Her place is clean and quaint. Nice linens and comfortable bed. Great location and price.
Really liked the minimal/retro decor in this place. It was just what I needed on this trip!
Clean, natural environment with a good choice of furniture. Kitchen is small but does the job and the windows provide a great view
The building itself isn’t the nicest, but the unit was spotless and aesthetic. The unit had everything we needed. We enjoyed our one-night stay!
Amazing Condo, warm and cozy and Lisa is very helpful and amazing with directions. Would definitely rent again for future trips to Lincoln, NE.
Very nice place to stay. Board games and close to the down town area. Quick communication.Truly enjoyed are stay. Apartment is a little loud in the wind but fine other than that.

I was looking for a place to put my head down during a road trip, but especially a place to do a little laundry.
I am not faulting anything for the stairs, I just missed the information, but…
The lock box is precariously hanging from a ladder over the 35 foot drop to the ground. The stairs are transparent, so anyone with a fear of heights beware! And, finally, there was no washer and dryer. I am sure there was a facility somewhere on site, but I don’t think that is what anyone is looking for when the ad says the unit has a w/d. Also, we had to use the photo of the parking spot to figure out the spot because the painting was so faded. If it were not for all the photos the host sent, we would have been lost. I was also unsure if I needed the parking pass in my car. I assumed so, so add an extra run up and down the stairs to put the pass in the car and to put the pass back in the apartment when leaving. One quick fix would be to put the lockbox at the bottom of the stairs instead of the top. Finally, a $64 room cost me over $120. I am new to Airbnb, but this is ridiculous. Am I paying resort fees or something? Hiding extra profit in “cleaning” is bad faith, like a $5 eBay auction with $30 shipping.

This space is great! And in an awesome location! I had such a nice time here in Lincoln. The only downside was that I was only there for one night! If I ever swing back through again you know for sure that I’ll be wanting to stay here :)

Had a very smooth and comfortable stay in Lincoln. Would stay at Lisa’s again!
Lynn
This apartment was the perfect little stop in downtown Lincoln - very walkable, tidy, bright, and comfortable. We'll likely be back!
It was great for me!
Really nice place in a great location!

This cute little condo was perfect for an overnight getaway for my husband and I. It is decorated mid-century, had many thoughtful touches, the bed was comfortable, and the entire condo was very clean. Lisa does a great job of communicating and even sent pictures ahead of time to make check-in a breeze. Don't be discouraged by the appearance of the building, hallways, and stairs to get to the top floor. We recommend the outside stairs at the back of the building during nice weather since the condo is very near the top landing. This is a great value!
A nice little apartment. It's clean and walking distance to downtown.

The good: Lisa’s home was beautifully laid out and had just what we needed for our short stay. The instructions were clear, and she was fast to communicate with us when we needed assistance. No complaints.
The not so good: This isn’t on the host at all- it’s more my lack of foresight in my planning (which is why I still gave 5 stars). The apartment is on the fourth floor as is noted in the description (with no elevator)- and we were traveling cross country with a toddler- so not only did we have a few bags and things to bring in, but it was really cold with 4 flights of stairs to climb, plus fumbling in the dark over the lock box, a door that swings toward you to open, and a mostly student-occupied building which made the check in process an overwhelming one. I think if I was traveling alone or with one other person it would be fine, but this mama was at the end of her rope carrying a fussy toddler up a zillion stairs with heavy bags. We ended up leaving a lot of what we had originally planned to bring in in the car because of the stairs situation. Again, this isn’t on the host- the description was accurate. This was just my experience. I wouldn’t suggest it if you have a baby or toddler- or if you’re not a light packer, like me.
Would be happy to come back all alone though! Haha!

Super cute apartment! Comfortable bed, nice style. Helps to think of this like a college apartment, because the place itself is super cute and clean, but the building where it is located definitely leaves something to be desired. The hallways are very dirty and smell like smoke and marijuana. I couldn’t smell that from within the apartment though (and I am super sensitive). Again, it was comfortable and cute once inside and quite comfortable! It’s not surrounded by downtown or a really cute neighborhood, but definitely able to walk to restaurants.
Such a cute space and very central location. Love the vintage feel!

This is a great Airbnb if you are needing a place in Lincoln! Not bad Ubering downtown and easy for Husker game day! Lisa has great communication when I had a question and a great host! The place was spotless when we arrived and lived up to the photos!
Nice little AirBnB in a apartment complex. Location is great for anything downtown.
This is a great air bnb for a weekend in Lincoln! Walking distance to downtown and Memorial Stadium.
Exactly as advertised!
This is a really cute condo and a step back in time. I’m pretty sure my mom lived in an apartment like this when she attended Lincoln School of Commerce in the late 40’s.
This is an adorable, well-cared for and well-designed 1 bedroom condo with an amazing view of the state capitol building and very convenient to downtown / UNL city campus.

The place was very clean and enjoyable, as depicted in the photos. However, the apartments around this Air BnB is another thing. Each floor smelled strongly of smoke, cannabis, and urine. Once we were inside our rental, we didn’t smell any of that, so kudos to the owners. However, if you’re expecting an apartment situation similar to what you’re seeing in the photos, be prepared for something else.

Exactly as described. Building reminds me of my first apartment in college, so be open minded and if you have mobility issues for stairs it’s not the unit for you. Bed and pillows were also comfortable. Uber to pinnacle bank arena was $7, very close to where you need to be!

I HIGHLY recommend Lisa’s apartment. She was very communicative and also flexible. I had to change my stay several times due to my work schedule and she accommodated wonderfully! Her explanation of check-in was so detailed and we had no problem. Also the internet is fast, rooms are spacious and very clean. I would definitely come back and stay at her apartment whenever I stay in Lincoln!
Apartment was perfect for a longer stay. Full kitchen and lots of space. Excellent communication with host.
Wonderfully nice apt.
Enjoyed the retro look of the apartment. Location is convenient to the state capital building - across the street!
Clean and tidy ! Check in was very detailed and straight forward ! Very nice location. Easy to get to.
Great location and very clean, thoughtful Airbnb.
Beautiful apartment, very clean, and Lisa was a very welcoming host. Great spot to stay for a few nights and explore the city.

Very cute and comfortable space. Air conditioner and neighrborhood was a little noisey but hostswere thoughtful and pjt earplugs in the room and the beddi g was so cozy i slept like a baby anyway and im a light sleeper. Great directions and location i stopped here to rest on my way from wisconsin to colorado and was able to go to a yoga class and whole foods nearby it was a nourishing pitstop
Super cute, super clean apartment! Such a gem in the building. Was only able to enjoy the apartment for one night, and would definitely go back!
beautiful apartment! great location in lincoln

Great little apartment! Good location, good suggestions for food, coffee, and drinks.
Overall cozy and comfortable!

Lisa's apartment is great! The kitchen works well, and the place is well air conditioned. The comments about the stairs are real—there are a lot of them—but it's manageable. Lisa was extremely good at communicating and arranged for me to have an early check-in, which was very kind. I definitely recommend it!
Wonderful stay! 10/10
Great location - within walking distance to downtown Lincoln.
gorgeous space! super clean and in a great location. Lisa gave detailed instructions making check in and check out very smooth
Such a great place to stay in Lincoln, NE super close to the capitol. Thanks Lisa!
Be prepared to walk through an unattractive hallway all the way to the 4th floor.

Lisa was absolutely wonderful to deal with. She was quick to respond and very helpful. The unit is clean and quiet, and the location is awesome. Even though it was in the 90s when I arrived the room was cool and comfortable.

This was the best Airbnb I have ever stayed in! Lisa puts great effort into the details in this beautiful apartment. I loved my stay here and would recommend it to anyone that is in Lincoln. She was great with communication, the apartment was clean and smelled fresh, the decor was beautiful, the bed was comfortable... I could just keep going on about this place. Thank you Lisa!
Beautiful and cozy spot near downtown. I've stayed here twice and it was perfect both times!
The apartment was very clean and adorable! The location was great, just beside the Capital building!
Good place for a short stay. Lisa communicates promptly and accurately.

I loved my stay at Capitol Condo! Lisa’s space is very clean, charming, and tastefully decorated. It’s close to downtown and the UNL campus. In summertime, it’s easy to bring a bike and use that to get most anywhere in town, and access to Lincoln’s bike paths is close by. I would definitely stay here again.

Lisa’s place was great. We were just in town for 1 night- needing a place to rest on a cross country road trip and Lisa’s place was perfect! Communication getting in was thorough, the apt was clean, and had everything we needed. Definitely recommend.
Beautiful on the inside.
Lisa was very specific with her instructions which made check-in and check-out a breeze. Her place was quiet and cozy and lovely.
Super responsive host. Easy check in check out. Cool location right next to capitol. Great place!

The place was very clean and comfortable! Walkable access to downtown amenities and easy to find. Parking was difficult to find in the lot, however, street parking was available. Great communication and overall great time!
Lisa was so quick with communication. The place was perfect for what we needed.
I would stay here all the time if I could I love the area in the city and the city over all. Her place was very clean and cute!
This was a beautiful stay in a great location near the capital! I was able to bike for most of the trip and came back to a cozy and clean apartment.
Nice unit. Clean with a very comfy bed.

Do not hesitate to book this apartment. Well-decorated, quiet, modern space directly across the street from Lincoln's Capitol building (walk inside the Capitol for a look!). Most hot spots & restaurants are a fast 5 minute drive or easy-to-walk 20 minutes away. Lisa's communication and trouble-shooting were top notch. Thanks so much for hosting us!
The space was perfect for the night. Convenient location! Would stay again!
Easy check-in and good communication!

Condo was warm and charming with a fun mid century vibe. Close to downtown for restaurants, and night life. Had everything we needed, and Lisa was quick to communicate when we had a question. If we are ever back in the area we’d definitely stay again.

Located in a pretty well traveled part of town, but in a good way. The parking area is a bit confusing, but luckily there was a gentlemen in the lot who informed us parking in the exactly right spot wasn't a big deal either way. My wife and I stayed here for a night and had to bring bikes up to the room with us...not ideal as the room is on the top floor and there is only stair access, but the host was gracious enough to let me know about this ahead of time which made me happy. The building is a bit older and with that comes the smells of an older building. Once you're in for a bit, you get used to it and overall, it's pretty good value as far and my wife and I were concerned.
I loved my stay was very clean and very pretty. Super convenient location to visit the capital. Had a great weekend trip.
The apartment itself is quiet and quaint right by city hall. Good price for a quick nights stay. The host was very communicative and provided excellent information for a smooth check in.

The space was amazing, and well-stocked! Lisa thought of everything! I was very impressed. The location was fantastic as well!
Note to future guests: if you're afraid of heights, use the front entrance!

Okay, so this was my first time using Airbnb and my goodness, this was a great first stay. I want to point out mainly the communication. Lisa provided the easiest check in with directions, photos for reference and much more. The place was so comfortable, and very clean. The bed.. omg the bed is so comfortable. The tub is deep so you can actually have a relaxing bath. The entire building is quiet.. as well as the area. No issues ❤️
So nice we stayed here twice! We used the condo as a landing pad on our way out West, and on our way back. Great location, nice place. Would definitely stay again.

I really enjoyed my stay at this apartment. I was in Lincoln for a week-long workshop, and I loved having this little oasis to retreat to. It was comfortable, clean and quiet, and just as adorable as in the pictures. The kitchen was well equipped, too. Other reviewers aren't kidding about the rest of the building. The halls are dingy and it looks a bit run-down. That said, I never felt unsafe, and the contrast between the sad halls and the perfectly decorated apartment was sort of entertaining to me. I would stay there again if I'm in Lincoln again!
The place was awesome and in a great location
Very cute place! Don't let the building out outside hallways fool you Lisa's place is very cozy and well decorated. I would recommend Lisa's place if you're in Lincoln.

Everything was fine until we came back to the room after enjoying a night out. It was warm when we left so we turned the window ac to the lowest setting and it never cooled down! Could not sleep in that heat! Definitely would like a refund!

The halls are filled with cigarette smoke. This location is convenient for downtown, but there are a lot of homeless people around and sketchy people who live in the building. No elevator. Nice decor.
Parking issues: My car was confused with another car and got towed. So I only stayed one night.
Lisa was not helpful about the tow situation and only reimbursed for half of the tow, although it was her property managements mix up.
I would Not recommend staying here but especially if you have kids. Not a kid friendly place.

Upon moving into this place I started hearing noises, scratching and the sounds of fur rubbing against the walls. She has a piece of paper and painters tape seperating the outside from the inside. I go to the window unit and saw a rodents eye looking back at me, as it was scratching up against the paper. I kindly notified the host and she apologized and stated she understood and she recommended me to cancel and she will give me a full refund and have her husband take a look later. I canceled and Lisa is now playing Casper, the unfriendly deceiving ghost. The place was quaint though. I advise you to stay if you like quaint spaces, small tv and the chance rodent eye and friends may join you in your stay.
